sentence.Network_en: I was never allowed to see her at the mortuary.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们不允许我去停尸房看她.

sentence.Network_en: I don't care. I'm feeling militant standing in front of this mortuary.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不在乎, 站在这个停尸间面前,我感觉自己像个斗士一样.

sentence.Network_en: In the mortuary there are many stiffened corpses.
sentence.Network_cn: 停尸房中摆满了僵冷的尸体.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting a gift claimed by a parish priest from a deceased person's estate): from Latin mortuarius, from mortuus 'dead'. The current noun sense dates from the mid 19th cent

entry.tran: (医院的)陈尸所，停尸房，太平间
entry.def: A mortuary is a building or a room in a hospital where dead bodies are kept before they are buried or cremated, or before they are identified or examined.
A mortuary is the same as a funeral home .

means.word_mean: 1. a building (or room) where dead bodies are kept before burial or cremation
1. of or relating to or characteristic of death
2. of or relating to a funeral

auth_sentence.content: The whole transport exactly filled the mortuary to capacity.
auth_sentence.res_content: The whole transport exactly filled the mortuary to capacity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The whole transport exactly filled the mortuary to capacity.

auth_sentence.content: The last time she saw them was in the mortuary.
auth_sentence.res_content: The last time she saw them was in the mortuary.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The last time she saw them was in the mortuary.

auth_sentence.content: Stephen Smith visits Mary Watts mortuary chapel.
